symbolic-struct:
[[var g = (6 - 2)]]
[[var v = (g + 5)]]
[[question w = ['v']]]
theme: Roller skates
statement: John had 6 pairs of roller skates, but he gave 2 pairs away to his friends. He then bought 5 more pairs from a garage sale. How many pairs of roller skates does John have now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var initial_skates = 6]]
[[var given_away = 2]]
[[var bought = 5]]
[[question skates_now = ['initial_skates - given_away + bought']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var g = (6 - 2)]]
[[var v = (g + 5)]]
[[var o = (v + 11)]]
[[question y = ['o']]]
theme: Roller skates
statement: After sorting out his roller skate collection, John decides to go shopping again and buys an additional 11 pairs of roller skates. How many pairs of roller skates does John have in total now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var initial_skates = 6]]
[[var given_away = 2]]
[[var first_purchase = 5]]
[[var second_purchase = 11]]
[[question skates_now = ['initial_skates - given_away + first_purchase + second_purchase']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var g = (11 - 2)]]
[[var v = (g + 5)]]
[[question w = ['v']]]
theme: Roller skates
statement: Suppose that John originally had 11 pairs of roller skates, not 6, before giving away 2 pairs and subsequently buying 5 pairs from a garage sale. How many pairs of roller skates would John have then?
new symbolic struct:
[[var initial_skates = 11]]
[[var given_away = 2]]
[[var bought = 5]]
[[question skates_now = ['initial_skates - given_away + bought']]]

statement: In a park, there are 3 squirrels playing on a tree and 6 more squirrels foraging on the ground. How many squirrels are there in total in that part of the park?

symbolic-struct:
[[var i = (3 + 6)]]
[[var v = (i + i)]]
[[question b = ['v']]]
theme: Park
statement: In addition to the 9 squirrels in one part of the park, there are an equal number of squirrels in another part of the park. How many squirrels are there in total in both parts of the park?

In a different scenario, instead of there being 3 squirrels playing on a tree in the park, what if there are 13 squirrels playing on the tree while the same 6 squirrels are still foraging on the ground? How many squirrels would there be in total in that part of the park now?
Daisy initially had 13 lemons. After making lemonade, she ended up using 2 lemons. How many lemons does Daisy have left?

symbolic-struct:
[[var h = (13 - 2)]]
[[var v = (8 + h)]]
[[question t = ['v']]]
theme: Lemon
statement: In addition to the lemons she had left, Daisy buys 8 more lemons from the store. How many lemons does she have now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 13]]
[[var b = 2]]
[[var s = a - b]]
[[var c = 8]]
[[question d = ['s + c']]]

statement: Suppose, originally Daisy had 18 lemons instead of 13. After making lemonade, if she still used 2 lemons as before, how many lemons would she have left now?

In a robotics competition, William's robot can score 13 points in total. However, due to a minor technical malfunction, it scores 8 points less. After fixing the issue, he manages to accrue an additional 5 points. What is his robot's total score now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var total_points = 13]]
[[var points_lost = 8]]
[[var points_after_fix = 5]]
[[question score = ['total_points - points_lost + points_after_fix']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var c = (13 - 8)]]
[[var h = (c + 5)]]
[[var r = (h - 3)]]
[[question w = ['r']]]
theme: Robot
statement: Following the previous situation, William's robot encounters another malfunction and loses 3 points from its total score. What is his robot's total score now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var total_points = 13]]
[[var points_lost = 8]]
[[var points_after_fix = 5]]
[[var second_malfunction = 3]]
[[question final_score = ['total_points - points_lost + points_after_fix - second_malfunction']]]

statement: At the beginning of the day, the sky was clear with 8 rainbows spotted by an observatory. Later, the weather changed and 4 additional rainbows appeared. How many rainbows were seen in total by the observatory that day?
After the 12 rainbows appeared, one of them faded away. How many rainbows remained visible in the sky at the end of the day?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 8]]
[[var b = 4]]
[[var c = a + b]]
[[var d = 1]]
[[question r = ['c - d']]]

statement: Let's say instead of 8 rainbows appearing at the beginning of the day, only 4 rainbows were spotted. Later, the weather still changed and 4 additional rainbows appeared as before. How many rainbows would have been seen in total by the observatory under these circumstances?

symbolic-struct:
[[var i = 10]]
[[var v = (15 - i)]]
[[question b = ['v']]]
theme: Dolphin
statement: A dolphin trainer starts with 15 fish to give as rewards during training sessions. After the first series of tricks, he has already given 10 fish to the dolphins. How many fish does he have left for the rest of the session?

symbolic-struct:
[[var i = 6]]
[[var v = (15 - i)]]
[[question b = ['v']]]
theme: Dolphin
statement: Suppose that instead of giving 10 fish to the dolphins during the first series of tricks, the trainer had only given 6 fish. If he started with 15 fish, how many fish would he have left for the rest of the session in this scenario?
Chloe baked 2 cookies in the morning and additionally baked 14 cookies in the evening. How many cookies did Chloe bake in total?
Suppose Chloe initially baked 6 cookies in the morning instead of 2, and additionally baked 14 cookies in the evening like before. How many cookies did Chloe bake in total now?
A zookeeper spotted 7 elephants when he entered the enclosure. To his surprise, a new arrival was added. How many elephants are there in the enclosure now?
Alexa has a collection of 7 pairs of silver earrings. She buys 11 more pairs from an online shop. After giving 2 pairs to her best friend, how many pairs of earrings does she end up with?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 7]]
[[var b = 11]]
[[var c = 2]]
[[question d = ['a + b - c']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var x = (7 + 11)]]
[[var q = (x - 2)]]
[[var j = (q + 2)]]
[[question i = ['j']]]
theme: Earrings
statement: After a few days, she found 2 pairs of earrings that she previously misplaced. Adding those to her current collection, how many pairs of earrings does Alexa have now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 7]]
[[var b = 11]]
[[var c = 2]]
[[var d = a + b - c]]
[[var e = 2]]
[[question f = ['d + e']]]

statement: Suppose instead Alexa initially had 7 pairs of earrings, but this time she buys an additional 12 pairs online. After still giving 2 pairs to her friend, how many pairs of earrings would she have then?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 7]]
[[var b = 12]]
[[var c = 2]]
[[question d = ['a + b - c']]]

statement: A deck of cards has 8 suits: hearts and spades, plus 1 special suit. How many suits are there in total in the deck?
new symbolic struct:
[[var h = 1]]
[[var s = 1]]
[[var special = 1]]
[[var other_suits = (8 - h - s - special)]]
[[question total_suits = ['h + s + special + other_suits']]]

statement: Suppose initially, the deck had 9 traditional suits in addition to the 1 special suit Arya found earlier. In this case, how many suits were there in the deck originally?

symbolic-struct:
[[var v = (8 - 7)]]
[[var w = (10 + v)]]
[[question l = ['w']]]
theme: Zoo
statement: There are 8 lions at the zoo, but 7 have been moved to a different zoo. The number of tigers at the zoo is this new lion count plus 10. How many tigers are at the zoo?
new symbolic struct:
[[var l = 8]]
[[var m = 7]]
[[var n = l - m]]
[[var t = n + 10]]
[[question T = ['t']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var v = (8 - 7)]]
[[var w = (15 + v)]]
[[question l = ['w']]]
theme: Zoo
statement: Let's change the situation a bit. Suppose there were 8 lions at the zoo, but 7 of them were still moved to a different zoo. Instead of 10 tigers, this time there are 15 tigers at the zoo, accounting for the lions that were moved. How many tigers are there now at the zoo?
new symbolic struct:
[[var o = 8]]
[[var p = 7]]
[[var q = o - p]]
[[var r = q + 15]]
[[question T_new = ['r']]]

[[var p = 10]]
[[var u = (p + 9)]]
[[question x = ['u']]]

statement: In a game, Max has a treasure chest with 10 gold coins. Later, he finds another set of coins that increase his total to 9 coins more than he had initially. How many gold coins does Max have now?

[[var p = 10]]
[[var u = (p + 9)]]
[[var g = (u - 4)]]
[[question y = ['g']]]
theme: Treasure chest
statement: Max suddenly realizes that he has to pay 4 gold coins as a tax to the king of the game. How many gold coins will Max be left with after paying the tax?

[[var y = (x + 9)]]
[[var a = 4]]
[[var b = y - a]]

statement: Suppose that Max initially had 11 gold coins instead of 10 in his treasure chest before he found the additional set of coins. How many gold coins would Max have then after finding the additional coins?
Suzy has 6 pieces of candy. She then receives 1 more from her friend. How many pieces of candy does Suzy now have?

Following the previous situation, what if Suzy initially had 7 pieces of candy instead of 6, and then she receives 1 more from her friend just like before? How many pieces of candy would Suzy have then?
John has a collection of 17 books. He goes to the bookstore and buys 2 more books. How many books does John have in his library now?
After adding 2 new books to his library, John decides to give away 5 books as gifts to his friends. How many books does John have left in his library now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var x = 17]]
[[var y = 2]]
[[var a = x + y]]
[[var b = 5]]
[[question z = ['a - b']]]

statement: In the original scenario, John started with 17 books, but what would have happened if he initially had only 2 books, and he still bought 2 more from the bookstore? How many books would John have had in his library then?
Mary originally has 20 dolls. She gives 6 of her dolls to her friend. How many dolls does Mary have now?
Continuing the scenario, imagine that initially Mary only had 9 dolls instead of 20. If she gave away 6 dolls to her friend as before, how many dolls would Mary have left?
Captain Jack had 3 parrots. Later, he found and added 6 more parrots to his crew. How many parrots does Captain Jack have in total?
If initially, Captain Jack had 14 parrots instead of 3, and he still found and added 6 more, how many parrots would he have in total then?
Liam has 8 piano keys to start with. Later in the day, he adds 3 more out of necessity. How many piano keys does Liam have now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var x = (8 + 3)]]
[[var k = (5 + x)]]
[[question s = ['k']]]
theme: Piano
statement: Following the additions earlier in the day, Liam decides to add 5 more piano keys to further expand his range. Now, how many piano keys does Liam have in total?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 8]]
[[var b = 3]]
[[var c = a + b]]
[[var d = 5]]
[[question e = ['c + d']]]

statement: Following the earlier additions, let's consider a different scenario where Liam starts with 17 piano keys instead of the original 8. If he still adds 3 more keys as he did in the previous scenario, how many piano keys would Liam have now in this case?
A pack of lions consists of 10 female lions. The unique feature of a lion pack is that it allows 4 males, as well. How many lions are there in the pack in total?

Instead of originally having 10 female lions in the pack as mentioned in the first question, if there were 15 female lions and the 4 males still joined, how many lions would be there in the pack in total now?
A doctor come across 4 patients in the morning and later treats 10 more patients in the afternoon. How many patients did the doctor treat throughout the day?

symbolic-struct:
[[var r = (4 + 10)]]
[[var p = (19 - r)]]
[[question j = ['p']]]
theme: Doctor
statement: After treating patients all day, the doctor still had other administrative tasks to complete. Initially, he had 19 tasks to finish, but he managed to complete the same number of tasks as the number of patients he treated. How many tasks does he still have left to complete?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 4]]
[[var b = 10]]
[[var total_patients = a + b]]
[[var initial_tasks = 19]]
[[question remaining_tasks = ['initial_tasks - total_patients']]]

A wizard casts a spell that creates 12 magical orbs. Then, he performs another spell and conjures 8 more orbs. How many magical orbs does the wizard have in total?
After conjuring up the orbs, the wizard decides to use 2 of the orbs to power his magic staff. How many magical orbs does he have left now?

Let's consider a change. Instead of creating 12 magical orbs initially, the wizard had only conjured up 10 orbs. Then, he performed another spell and made 8 more orbs. How many magical orbs would the wizard have in total in this case?
A young dinosaur enthusiast has 13 dinosaur figurines. He decides to give 8 of them to his best friend. How many dinosaur figurines is he left with?
After a thoughtful night, the young dinosaur enthusiast decides to give one more of his dinosaur figurines to his best friend. How many dinosaur figurines does he have left then?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 13]]
[[var b = 8]]
[[var d = 1]]
[[var e = a - b]]
[[question f = ['e - d']]]

statement: What if initially, the young dinosaur enthusiast had given 6 of his dinosaur figurines to his best friend instead of 8? How many dinosaur figurines would he have left then?

symbolic-struct:
[[var g = 6]]
[[var z = (20 - g)]]
[[question l = ['z']]]

statement: What if Maya initially had 9 beads instead of 6 when she started making her first bracelet? How many beads would she have left to use for her next bracelet?

John has 11 blue pens and 5 red pens. How many pens does John have in total?

theme: Giraffe
statement: At the zoo, we spotted 6 giraffes in one area, but 4 wandered off to another part of the habitat. A little later, an additional 11 giraffes came over from a neighboring enclosure. How many giraffes are now in this part of the habitat?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 6]]
[[var b = 4]]
[[var c = 11]]
[[question d = ['a - b + c']]]

statement: Sam has 18 chocolate candies. He eats 16 of them while watching a movie. How many chocolates does he have left?
After watching the movie, Sam's brother gives him 16 more chocolate candies. How many chocolates does Sam have now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var y = 16]]
[[var x = (18 - y)]]
[[var p = 16]]
[[question z = ['x + p']]]

statement: What if Sam initially had 18 chocolate candies but only ate 6 while watching the movie? How many chocolates would he have left in this case?

symbolic-struct:
[[var y = 6]]
[[var c = (9 - y)]]
[[question h = ['c']]]
theme: Shirt
statement: John bought 9 shirts last week but gave 6 shirts away to his friends. How many shirts does John have left now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var y = 6]]
[[var c = (9 - y)]]
[[var z = (c + 13)]]
[[question m = ['z']]]
theme: Shirt
statement: After realizing he gave away too many, John decided to buy 13 more shirts. How many shirts does John have now in total?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 9]]
[[var b = 6]]
[[var c = a - b]]
[[var d = 13]]
[[question e = ['c + d']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var y = 6]]
[[var c = (17 - y)]]
[[question h = ['c']]]
theme: Shirt
statement: John originally thought he had bought 17 shirts last week, but then he remembered he only bought 6 before giving some away to his friends. How many shirts would John have left if he actually started with 17 shirts?
Peter had 16 carrots altogether. But then he gave 2 carrots to his pet rabbit, how many carrots does he have left now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var u = 16]]
[[var s = (u - 2)]]
[[var j = (15 - s)]]
[[question e = ['j']]]
theme: Carrot
statement: Peter then notices that he needs 15 carrots to make his carrot soup recipe. How many more carrots does he need to be able to make the soup?
new symbolic struct:
[[var y = 2]]
[[var t = 16]]
[[var x = (t - y)]]
[[var r = 15]]
[[question l = ['r - x']]]

statement: Now imagine if Peter had given 10 carrots to his pet rabbit instead of just 2. How many carrots would he have left then?
A local shop opens at 13.00 hour. Five hours later, what will be the time on the clock?
The local shop usually closes one hour before the time it is supposed to. At what time will the shop actually close after it opens at 13.00 hour and is supposed to stay open for 5 hours?
new symbolic struct:
[[var startTime = 13]]
[[var openDuration = 5]]
[[var earlyClose = 1]]
[[question actualCloseTime = ['startTime + openDuration - earlyClose']]]

statement: Gary has a total of 16 pairs of pants in his wardrobe. Later, he buys a new pair on his shopping trip. How many pairs of pants does he have now?
Janet has 8 crayons, and gives 3 of them to her friend, Anna. How many crayons does Janet have left now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var m = (8 - 3)]]
[[var i = (2 + m)]]
[[question n = ['i']]]
theme: Crayon
statement: Janet finds 2 more crayons in her bag after giving some to Anna. How many crayons does she have in total now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 3]]
[[var j = (8 - a)]]
[[var b = 2]]
[[var t = (j + b)]]
[[question y = ['t']]]

statement: Let's say initially, Janet had 14 crayons instead of 8 before she gave 3 of them to her friend, Anna. How many crayons would she have had left in this case?
A rabbit found 5 carrots in the backyard and one more in the front yard. How many carrots in total did the rabbit find?
After finding those carrots, the rabbit finds one more carrot in the neighbor's yard. How many total carrots has the rabbit found now?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 5]]
[[var b = 1]]
[[var d = 1]]
[[var e = a + b]]
[[question f = ['e + d']]]

statement: If originally the rabbit found 17 carrots in the backyard instead of 5, and still found one in the front yard, how many total carrots would the rabbit have found?
Emma is on a plane that is flying 9 hours to reach her layover. After a short rest, she will then fly for another 3 hours to reach her final destination. How long is her total flying time?
An alien has 3 eyes on one side of its head and 5 on the other. How many total eyes does the alien have?
Let's revisit our previous question. What if the first alien only had 3 eyes on one side of its head, but still had 8 eyes on the other side. How many total eyes does this alien have now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var j = (7 + 3)]]
[[var q = (14 - j)]]
[[question l = ['q']]]
theme: Circus
statement: A circus has 14 clowns, but 7 plus 3 of them decide to leave the circus. How many clowns are left at the circus?

symbolic-struct:
[[var j = (3 + 3)]]
[[var q = (14 - j)]]
[[question l = ['q']]]
theme: Circus
statement: Suppose initially, instead of 7 clowns leaving the circus, only 3 plus 3 clowns decided to leave. Then how many clowns would have been left at the circus?
Melissa has 5 blankets in her living room. She finds 14 more stashed away in her wardrobe. How many blankets does she have in total?
After counting all the blankets, Melissa decides to donate 6 of them to a local shelter. How many blankets does she have left after her kind donation?
new symbolic struct:
[[var x = 5]]
[[var y = 14]]
[[var t = x + y]]
[[var d = 6]]
[[question b = ['t - d']]]

statement: Suppose Melissa initially had 9 blankets in her wardrobe instead of 14. How many blankets would she have in total then?
A geometry box contains 18 shapes. If one shape is removed, how many shapes are left in the box?
After removing one shape, there are still too many shapes left in the geometry box. Arya decides to remove 8 more shapes. How many shapes would be left in the geometry box then?
new symbolic struct:
[[var m = 18]]
[[var n = 1]]
[[var o = 8]]
[[var p = m - n]]
[[question q = ['p - o']]]

symbolic-struct:
[[var c = 11]]
[[var f = (1 + c)]]
[[question m = ['f']]]
theme: Scooter
statement: Charlie has 11 scooters in his collection. He then adds one more to it by purchasing the latest model. How many scooters does Charlie have now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var c = 11]]
[[var f = (1 + c)]]
[[var t = (f - 6)]]
[[question y = ['t']]]
theme: Scooter
statement: After realizing his collection is getting too big, Charlie decides to sell some of his scooters. If he sells 6 of them, how many scooters does he have left?

symbolic-struct:
[[var c = 4]]
[[var f = (1 + c)]]
[[question m = ['f']]]
theme: Scooter
statement: Instead of having initially 11 scooters, what if Charlie started with only 4 scooters in his collection and then added one more? How many scooters would Charlie have now?

symbolic-struct:
[[var e = 6]]
[[var g = (4 + e)]]
[[question m = ['g']]]
theme: Dinosaur
statement: In the morning, Alex saw 6 dinosaurs near his campsite, and in the afternoon he saw 4 more. How many dinosaurs did Alex see in total?

symbolic-struct:
[[var e = 15]]
[[var g = (4 + e)]]
[[question m = ['g']]]
theme: Dinosaur
statement: Initially, Alex saw 15 dinosaurs in the morning instead of 6. After adding the 4 he saw in the afternoon, how many dinosaurs did then Alex see before the evening?
A baby Tyrannosaurus Rex had 3 teeth when it was born. Every week, the baby T-Rex grows 3 more teeth. How many teeth does the T-Rex have after one week?

symbolic-struct:
[[var c = 3]]
[[var k = (c + 3)]]
[[var l = (11 - k)]]
[[question s = ['l']]]
theme: Dinosaur
statement: The baby Tyrannosaurus Rex with its new teeth was curious about the adult Tyrannosaurs. It learned that, on average, an adult T-Rex has 11 teeth. After growing its new teeth, how many more teeth does the baby T-Rex need to grow to have as many teeth as an adult T-Rex?
new symbolic struct:
[[var a = 3]]
[[var b = 3]]
[[var c = a + b]]
[[var d = 11]]
[[question e = ['d - c']]]

statement: Suppose instead of the baby T-Rex having 3 teeth to start with, it only had 1 tooth when it was born. If it still grows 3 additional teeth each week, how many teeth will the baby T-Rex have after one week?

symbolic-struct:
[[var h = 15]]
[[var v = (h + 4)]]
[[question b = ['v']]]
theme: Beach ball
statement: David has 15 beach balls. He buys 4 more from a beach toy store. How many beach balls does David have in total now?

[[var w = (v - 3)]]
[[question u = ['w']]]
theme: Beach ball
statement: In addition to his collection, David gave 3 of his beach balls to his friends. How many beach balls does he have left now?

[[var b = 4]]

[[question e = ['c - d']]]
